author: advaitasaha
content:
I kinda stumbled upon this fundamental question. If anyone can help me out on this, regarding Elliptic Curves in Verkle Tries

Banderwagon is just a subgroup over the bandersnatch curve. Yet in all the implementation the equality check for points is different in banderwagon than that of in bandersnatch. Why?
I was expecting to find some mathematical reason, or if anyone can point me to some resource

author: jsign
content:
Banderwagon isn't a subgroup of the Bandersnatch curve. It's actually a completely different "group" constructed as a quotient group of Bandersnatch.
Internally, it uses Bandersnatch points.. but actually a Banderwagon element isn't an elliptic curve point. 
That's the reason why the equality check (and some other operations) are different from Bandersnatch points.

author: jsign
content: Mathematically speaking, a Banderwagon element can be seen as an equivalence class between Bandersnatch points (of size 2)

author: jsign
content: Probably the best resource to understand the logic for the construction is: https://hackmd.io/wliPP_RMT4emsucVuCqfHA?view

author: jsign
content:
<@706747269424218124>, the more "down to earth" answer to the equality difference is that there're two points in Bandersnatch that map to the same Banderwagon element.
If you'd use the same equality check in Bandersnatch, that couldn't solve that situation since there're two points that should be equal under "Banderwagon semantics".

author: advaitasaha
content:
Okkkkk got it 
Now I can connect the dots.
Thanks a lot for this explanantion
